instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, has all rails
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> appears to have all G3H and S5 rails at the right voltages, green light that responds to SMC reset yet no power. <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> had a little bit of crud on it so I replaced that, no other issues visually with the board.

I ran out of hints as where to look next. Any pointers appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, has all rails
threads.message: Light turning orange? Check for power pulsing. The usual suspects inspected? <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/1950, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> termination resistors/traces? Check rails for short? PPBUS voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, has all rails
threads.message:
Green light turns orange after a few sec and stays that way.

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> has 3.3 or 3.4V on pins 1, 2, 5 and 13. 372mV on pin 12 and 60/70mV on pin 4 (this was 330mV when I measure before and before that it was fluctuating all over the place. Not it holds steady at 60/70mV).

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> 16mV pin 2, 3.4V pin 8.

<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> 3.3V all pins, continuity from all pins to their destinations OK.

PPBUS is 12.6V at F7140.

Would rails show the right voltage if there's a short?

Amp draw on PSU is 0.021/23

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, has all rails
threads.message: A shorted line will not have voltage on it cause it is shorted to GND. Still need to know if it may be power cycling, check on the 5V rail L7520. Preferably use a scope as many multimeters are too slow to catch the short pulses. Again check all rails for shorts to GND.
